image.altText: The outline of kids boarding a school bus can just be seen through the reflective glass of the bus windscreen.

props.synopsis: Parents in Katherine are urging the Northern Territory government to increase safety measures on school buses, after raising the alarm about fighting and bullying onboard.

title.children: Katherine parents raise alarm over violence, bullying on school buses

image.altText: A boy wearing a light green swim rashy, has two hands on a water pump and smiles at the camera in a school playground.

props.synopsis: James and Ollie are the best of friends, but they don't get to see each other very often. That's why they love "in-school week" at Alice Springs School of the Air.

title.children: In-school week 'really, really important' to remote station kids

image.altText: A double-lane street lined with trees and a tall building on the left. A ute is driving away

props.synopsis: The man was allegedly attacked by three people on Mitchell Street, with police describing the incident as a "disgraceful attack on a vulnerable member of our society".

title.children: 101yo on mobility scooter target of 'disgraceful attack' in Darwin CBD

image.altText: A locked gate with a large 'no unauthorised entry' sign affixed to it.

props.synopsis: The company operating the Northern Territory's McArthur River Mine, one of the world's largest lead and zinc mines, has been convicted and fined for unlawful works on a sacred site spanning 13 years.

title.children: Mining giant fined for unlawful works on NT sacred site over 13 years

image.altText: An aerial view of a setting sun on a small settlement next to a tropical bay

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's Country Liberal Party government was elected on a tough on crime mandate. The NT's biggest remote community is accusing it of overlooking that in the bush.

title.children: Remote NT community grappling with its own crime crisis

image.altText: White woman with brown curled hair tied back in bun, wearing navy blue blazer and olive blouse.

props.synopsis: An independent NT politician says the public deserves to know the identity of a senior government bureaucrat found to have engaged in "improper conduct" by the corruption watchdog.

title.children: Chief minister bound to secrecy on 'incompetent' public servant's identity

image.altText: Darwin Port sign above ship.

props.synopsis: High-level discussions between the Northern Territory and federal governments are set to take place this week over the future of the Darwin Port, as the NT treasurer calls for certainty about Commonwealth plans for the facility.

title.children: NT calls for 'certainty' from federal government over Darwin Port future

image.altText: A tall fence with razor wire attached at the bottom and top. Blue sky and some jail buildings in the background.

props.synopsis: Private security guards will soon work alongside Northern Territory correctional staff after the NT government signed a contract with controversial global security firm G4S.

title.children: Private security firm G4S to help manage record high NT prisoner numbers

image.altText: A close-up of Donald Trump, who wears a suit and US flag pin and glances sideways.

props.synopsis: As Democrats heckled and Republicans cheered, four robed figures sat silently through Donald Trump's speech. They could form part of his biggest barrier.

title.children: While Democrats heckled, Trump's biggest obstacles sat quietly

image.altText: Hamas militants with faces covered pointing guns in air.

props.synopsis: The White House confirms that "ongoing talks and discussions" are being held between US and Hamas officials, as Donald Trump issues another warning to the Palestinian militant group.

title.children: US confirms talks with Hamas as Trump issues 'last warning' on hostage releases

image.altText: A mugshot style photo of a man in his twenties in a tshirt

props.synopsis: Police feared a healthcare murderer could have been a serial killer after they searched his bedroom and found stolen medical items and a collection of death notices.

title.children: Mysterious stash of funeral notices raises fears of a serial killer's 'trophies'

image.altText: People work at desks in an airy room, sitting in front of computers.

props.synopsis: Workplaces in the US are witnessing a mass reversal of diversity, equity and inclusion programs following President Donald Trump's return to power. Could the same thing happen here in Australia?

title.children: Do we need a reset when it comes to diversity and inclusion at work?

image.altText: A designed image showing Peter Dutton, Anthony Albanese and Fiona Phillips standing together with the text "Compare the pair".

props.synopsis: Ousted CFMEU officials are targeting Labor MPs in marginal electorates with social media attack ads that political analysts say could help the Coalition pick up seats in this year's federal election.

title.children: Ousted CFMEU officials funding ads attacking Labor in marginal seats

image.altText: Aerial view of Atlantic salmon being pulled from a pen by hose and into a bin.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian salmon producer Huon Aquaculture launches a "full investigation" after video taken at one of its fish farms showed live salmon being siphoned out of a pen and sealed in tubs with piles of dead fish.

title.children: Fish farm 'extremely disappointed' after live salmon sealed in tub

image.altText: An aerial view of poweer station with two large smoke stacks

props.synopsis: Australia's coal-fired power stations are unreliable and driving up electricity prices, according to a new report out today, on the eve of a federal election campaign in which the viability of keeping coal plants going longer will be a key focus.

title.children: 'Expensive, improbable': The case against extending coal-fired power

image.altText: A map shows Cyclone Alfred approaching the Queensland coastline

props.synopsis: Tropical Cyclone Alfred will continue its approach towards the south-east Queensland coast today, with the far western edge already impacting the coast from about Coolangatta to Ballina.

title.children: When will Tropical Cyclone Alfred hit New South Wales and Queensland?

image.altText: Jake Averillo runs the ball at the Rabbitohs defence during an NRL match.

props.synopsis: South Sydney coach Wayne Bennett supports the NRL's move to relocate the Rabbitohs' match against the Dolphins, as Brisbane prepares for Tropical Cyclone Alfred.

title.children: Bennett backs NRL's decision to go ahead with Dolphins-Rabbitohs match

image.altText: Two men watch waves next to a parking sign

props.synopsis: As Cyclone Alfred nears land, bringing potentially up to 400 millimetres of rain, residents across the state's north are continuing to prepare.

title.children: Today the 'day to act' ahead of Alfred's arrival, northern NSW communities told

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Australian markets are set to rise on Thursday, as more Trump tariff decisions move the dial on Wall Street overnight. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: More rolling Trump tariff decisions on car imports move financial markets

image.altText: a sunset or sunrise on the horizon with broken sea ice below nd clouds above

props.synopsis: Scientists have found it difficult to capture longer-term changes to Antarctic sea ice as satellite records date from 45 years ago, but a recent reconstruction winds the record back to 1899.

title.children: 'What's alarming is how we're not alarmed anymore': Sea ice drops again

image.altText: A couple's intertwined legs on a bed.

props.synopsis: Bacterial vaginosis affects one in three women and often comes back after treatment, but it can be completely wiped out in most cases if their male partner is treated too.

title.children: Australian discovery set to 'rewrite textbooks' about vaginal condition

image.altText: The pope, dressed all in white, makes a blessing gesture with one hand.

props.synopsis: Pope Francis has resumed some works while battling double pneumonia with a severe respiratory infection in the hospital for almost three weeks.

title.children: Pope resumes some work and remains in a stable condition, Vatican says

image.altText: A man uses a file on a piece of metal in a workshop.

props.synopsis: More than 130 TAFE courses are free in WA, but some question whether the initiative is effective at getting people into jobs in areas of skills shortages.

title.children: Free TAFE policy splits Liberal and Labor in the west ahead of election

image.altText: A crowd of people shopping in Pitt St Mall, Sydney.

props.synopsis: The HILDA report is a body of work that has surveyed 9,000 Australian households every year, for the last 22 years. Here's what they say has changed.

title.children: New report shows how Australian life has changed over last 20 years

image.altText: David Wenham with a mullet, Hawaiian shirt and split lip looks glum standing in front of two police officers

props.synopsis: One of David Wenham's most popular roles is from more than 20 years ago. Now, Johnny Francis "Spit" Spiteri is back, and he's still got a mullet and thongs.

title.children: David Wenham still gets stopped in the street over this iconic character

image.altText: A campsite set up in bushland.

props.synopsis: As the WA election draws promises to address the housing crisis, in one part of Perth where suburbs are bursting at the seams and homelessness is rising, services are pleading for urgent help.

title.children: Abandoned bush campsite in Perth's south-east a symbol of housing crisis

image.altText: A policeman in black uniform inspects two burnt out car wrecks on a sunny day

props.synopsis: The twin suicide bombing attack hit a military base, with a group linked to the Pakistani Taliban claiming responsibility.

title.children: Children and soldiers killed in suicide bombings in Pakistan

image.altText: A man standing in front of a water truck.

props.synopsis: South Australia's farmers are worried about water supplies for livestock as drought conditions cause dams to dry up across the state.

title.children: Dry dams leave SA farmers deciding to buy water or sell livestock

image.altText: Kai Lohmann and Cam Rayner of the Lions celebrate with the premiership cup in front of cheering fans

props.synopsis: The 2025 AFL season looks set to be desperately hard to separate the cream from the crop, with no side flawless, and almost every team harbouring hopes of playing footy in September.

title.children: Unpredictable AFL season 2025 set to be most open in years

image.altText: Someone with gloved hands touching a large bone.

props.synopsis: Archaeologists have discovered a large collection of ancient tools crafted out of hippopotamus and elephant bones, pushing back the age of bone tool kits made by humans a million years.

title.children: Million-year-old tools made of bone raise questions about human ancestors

image.altText: The words 'Mount Panorama' spelled out on the side of the hill from a distance.

props.synopsis: The federal Nationals candidate for Calare, Sam Farraway, has been criticised for falsely claiming the future of the Bathurst 1000 race at Mount Panorama-Wahluu is threatened by a First Nations land claim.

title.children: Politicians heckled for misinformation about Bathurst 1000 closure

image.altText: Two grey fighter jets fly side-by-side against a blue and lightly cloudy sky

props.synopsis: The Philippine jet was engaged on a mission to help fight communist guerilla fighters in the country's south when it lost contact.

title.children: Mystery surrounds Philippines fighter jet crash that killed two pilots

image.altText: trucks and cars on highway

props.synopsis: Labor announces a $1.1 billion Western Highway upgrade, with most of the funding to go towards improving the freeway between Melton and Caroline Springs.

title.children: Labor pitches $1b freeway upgrade to Melbourne's west ahead of election

image.altText: Two identical men in camo gear stand in front of an icy landscape.

props.synopsis: In Mickey 17, South Korean director Bong Joon-ho takes on a terrifying technological advancements with the aid of a very willing Robert Pattinson.

title.children: Bong Joon-ho's first film after winning Best Picture is one for the freaks
